page.title: 01UPPER WEARDALE GENERAL
page.content: Our block lies in Upper Weardale on the eastern fringes of the North Pennines. The Killhope and Burnhope Burns join at Wearhead to form the River Wear which flows diagonally west to east across the upper half. The valley floor here is never less than 1000ft above sea level and the hills that enclose the valley rise to heights of well over 2000ft, Burnhope Seat at 2368ft being the highest point in Durham County. Within our block lie the villages of Wearhead and Ireshope- burn , the hamlets of West Blackdene, Newhouse and Middle Blackdene, outlying farms and groups of houses, the greater part of Burnhope Reservoir and the Weardale Minerals Plant. Most of the area is farmland (pasture and meadow,not arable) and rough moorland, with conifer plantations at Burnhope and Hawkwell Head.
